Whangārei JPs’ final week at city’s court as they move to public library https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/whangarei-jps-final-week-at-citys-court-as-they-move-to-public-library/NLAWLXMC25DDVKPENUIQO4LRFY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/whangarei-jps-final-week-at-citys-court-as-they-move-to-public-library/NLAWLXMC25DDVKPENUIQO4LRFY/ Sarah CurtisJustices leave court for more peaceful surrounds. Sun, 11 Aug 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Valerie Wong (left) and Deb Fong are among a large group of Ministerial JPs in lower Northland who provide a walk-in service for people needing various documents authorised. For the past 10 years the service has been based at the Whangārei courthouse but as of September 4, will operate out of Whangārei's Central Library. Photo / Sarah Curtis
